sen.e: TANGO no Naishi (date of birth and death unknown) was a woman who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.

sen.e: She was the first daughter of Hikinoama who was menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 『吉見系図』によると、京の二条天皇に女房として仕えており、惟宗広言と密かに通じて島津忠久を生み、離縁したのち関東へ下って安達盛長に嫁いだとしている。
sen.e: According to "the family tree of the Yoshimi clan," when she served to the Emperor Nijo in Kyoto as nyobo (a court lady), she formed a liaison with KOREMUNE no Hirokoto and delivered Tadahisa SHIMAZU, went to the Kanto region after divorce and married with Morinaga ADACHI.

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』によると養和2年（1182年）3月9日、頼朝の妻、北条政子が嫡男・源頼家を懐妊した際、着帯の儀式で食事の給仕を務める。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), she served as a waiter at the obi-wearing ceremony to pray for the safe delivery of the baby on April 20, 1182 when Masako HOJO, a wife of Yoritomo, was pregnant of MINAMOTO no Yoriie, their first son.

sen.j: 文治2年（1186年）6月10日、丹後内侍が病になると、頼朝は供2人だけを伴い、盛長の屋敷を密かに訪れて見舞っている。
sen.e: On July 5, 1186, when TANGO no Naishi was sick in bed, Yoritomo visited her secretly in the residence of Morinaga only with two followers.

sen.j: 頼朝は彼女の為に願掛けをし、数日後に丹後内侍が回復するといくらか安堵したという。
sen.e: It is said that Yoritomo made a wish to a god for her and felt easy when TANGO no Naishi recovered a few days later.

sen.j: このように頼朝に近しい女性であった事から、後年子の景盛が頼朝の子であるとする風説が出たり（『保暦間記』）、島津氏が祖の忠久が彼女と頼朝の子であると自称するなど、彼女を母とした二つの頼朝落胤説が見られる。
sen.e: Thus, since she was familiar with Yoritomo, there are two theories of Rakuin (child born out of wedlock) on Yoritomo in later years such as her son Kagemori was a son of Yoritomo ("Horyakukanki" (A History Book of the 14 century in Japan)) and Tadahisa SHIMAZU, the patriarch of the Shimazu clan, identified himself as a son between her and Yoritomo.
